intro: Tithymalus chesneyi, commonly known as the Chesney's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is often narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
